Haematology patients were shown to be particularly vulnerable to SARS‐CoV‐2 infection
3 and in need of shielding; hence alternative management plans and new ways of delivering care were implemented wherever possible to reduce individual patient susceptibility.
4 Various clinical guidelines were issued at unprecedented speed, including recommendations for multiple myeloma (MM) and patients needing stem cell transplantation (SCT).
